This feature cleans up the guardian feature flags published in heartbeat messages and displayed in the dashboard.

It does the following:

- Adds a feature flag for the TX Verifier feature.
- Introdu

prs.title: CCIP 1.5 - Tron
prs.truncated_body:
This PR introduces support for Tron within CCIP 1.5. 

The read side uses the standard EVM code paths but writing uses a Tron specific transmitter (`tron_transmitter.go`) that wraps the Tron TXM used in DF.

E2E tests have been running between Tron Nile <> Base Sepolia (Ping me if you'd like to see example transmits on-chain)

prs.title: Disable docker build cache in CI
prs.truncated_body: We were seeing intermittent failures ([example](https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink/actions/runs/14591879294/job/40928843312?pr=17096)) in CI at a ~10-15% rate with cache enabled. GitHub's cache is only 10 GB or so per repo so not a huge loss and build speeds don't seem to be impacted.

prs.title: devstack: devtest.T.Gate and match.Assume
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This makes it much easier to program test gates and filter down the system and skip if the system components are not available.

Test gates can be programmed in-place, like require-checks now.

Any matcher can now be wrapped with `match.SkipIfNone(t, <inner>)`, and it will skip the test if no match is found.

**Tests**

Covered the `SkipIfNone` util, and the Gate is used

prs.title: fix(kt-devnet): adjust to possible multiple depsets
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

The previous approach of associating a single dependency set to a
devnet doesn't work anymore, as we're aiming to work with multiple
interop sets, multiple supervisors, and so on.

We're also importing the corresponding optimism-package
version, and adjusting the interop devnet definition


<!--
A clear and concise description of the features you're adding in this pull request.
--

commits.message:
fix(kt-devnet): adjust to possible multiple depsets

The previous approach of associating a single dependency set to a
devnet doesn't work anymore, as we're aiming to work with multiple
interop sets, multiple supervisors, and so on.

We're also importing the corresponding optimism-package
version, and adjusting the interop devnet definition

Note that only kurtosis devnets provide a corresponding implementations for now.

For convenience, the orchestrator now embeds a DevnetEnv, which is the
enriched wrapper around descriptors.DevnetEnvironment (data-only
object)

Validated using a slightly adjusted version of
devnet-sd

commits.message:
test(sysext): add support for control plane

This implements the control plane interface for the sysext side of devstack.
Note that only kurtosis devnets provide a corresponding implementations for now.

For convenience, the orchestrator now embeds a DevnetEnv, which is the
enriched wrapper around descriptors.DevnetEnvironment (data-only
object)

Validated using a slightly adjusted version of
devnet-sdk/devstack/sysgo/control_plane_test.go but that's a temporary
measure. A real test against the devstack interfaces will be required.

prs.title: Framework for determinisitc tests for btcstaking protocol
prs.truncated_body:
Extends testing framework for deterministic cross module integration test to enable finality voting.

Also add nicer api to simulate operatoins mimicking how they happen in practice.

Use cases for this framework:
- cross module integration tests checking edge case scenarios
- replay tests to check determinism of particular scenarios

prs.title: fix: should not fail transaction if output is op_return when finding …
prs.truncated_body:
This PR is to fix issue on finding the staking output from tx where the OP_RETURN output has higher indexer order than the staking output.
For example a user who try to unbond the staking tx with below scenario:

Scenario 1: Fail
0 OP_RETURN xxxx
1 Staking output address

Scenario 1: Success
0 Staking output address
1 OP_RETURN xxxx

Example https://mempool.space/tx/551fc9785bd0d16f245f

commits.message: fix: should not fail transaction if output is op_return when finding output index

prs.title: chore(sdk): encode bigint prior to stringify
prs.truncated_body:
- encode bigints prior to JSON.stringify
- this fix is needed since we found browser extensions (e.g. initia wallet) may introduce a toJSON method to BigInt
- by doing so, the replacer passed to JSON.stringify to convert big ints to hex strings is bypassed

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON/stringify#:~:text=Attempting%20to%20serialize,by%20t

commits.message: chore(sdk): encode bigint prior to stringify

prs.title: chore(lib/netconf): support non-portal chains
prs.truncated_body:
Extend `netconf.Network` with support for non-portal (non-core) chains. This will be required in `solver` when adding non-core chain support.

The idea is:
 - load network from portal registry like we do now
 - then add a set of hardcoded external chains (for that network).
 
No additional changes should be required.

issue: none

prs.title: fix(pyth-lazer-puiblisher-sdk): Add Deployment Script
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Cargo publish only includes files within the folder containing the Cargo.toml file for the package being published. This means the proto files are not included. As packaging collects files first before building, the normal build process will not work. 

As a result, a specialized build script is needed to coerce the files in such a way that they can be published without impacting l

prs.title: Implement fee-related changes of CAP-66.
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Implement fee-related changes of [CAP-66](https://github.com/stellar/stellar-protocol/blob/master/core/cap-0066.md).

This includes the following changes:
- use the disk read bytes in place of overall read bytes, i.e. only account for the classic and restored entries (the latter is no a part of this PR)
- use the module memory size for the contract code entries instead of their XDR

commits.message:
Implement fee-related changes of CAP-66.

This includes the following changes:
- use the disk read bytes in place of overall read bytes, i.e. only account for the classic and restored entries (the latter is no a part of this PR)
- use the module memory size for the contract code entries instead of their XDR size for rent computations
- rename the fee-related fields appropriately
- update simulation and invocation metering to follow the new logic

Rebase and adapt to the XDR changes.

This adapts the code to use the newly introduced `ContractId` type alias for contract ids, as well as renames of the config and resource field names.
Update wasm-bindgen to the latest version in order to get it to build in newer rust version.

prs.title: additional-libs feature for keyring dependencies (secure store)
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Adds an `additional-libs` feature so that users can build and use the CLI (without keyring support) without having `libdbus-1-dev` installed on their system

### Why

Allows for a smaller binary, and less system dependencies.

### Known limitations

This PR only handles the keyring dependencies, I'll put the ledger work in a separate PR: https://github.com/stellar/stellar-cli/pul

commits.message: Add an additional libs feature for keyring crate
Return an error if a user tries to create a StellarEntry without additional-libs

handle add-libs feature flagging in keyring.rs

- move write_to_secure_store to keyring.rs
Handle keyring specific errors in keyring.rs
Start to move additional-libs feature to secure_store.rs

Remove dependencies to secret.rs and locator.rs from secure_store.rs

In upcoming refactors, secret.rs and locator.rs are going to depend on
secure_store directly, instead of keyring.rs so that keyring.rs can be
entirely behind a feature flag. Without the changes in this commit there
is a cyclical dependency on secret -> secure_store -> secret. Same for
locator.
Use secure_store in locator remove_identity instead of keyring directly
Use secure_store in secret to get pub key instead of keyring directly
Use secure_store to get pub key in signer/mod
Use secure_store to sign tx data instead of keyring directly

Remove feature flag from keyring.rs

this mod is only included when the feature is enabled
Refactor to cleanup unreachable code warnings
Update Makefile to include additional-libs feature

additional-libs feature for ledger-stellar dependencies (ledger signing) (#2011)

* Add stellar-ledger crate to additional-libs feature, and make optional

* Create a GenericLedger for when additional-libs feature is not enabled

* Change ledger::ledger fn to ledger::new

* Simplify ledger_impl

* Move stellar-ledger specific things to ledger_impl

* Move ledger feature switching to ledger.rs

* Enable additional-libs in emulator workflow

Set the DOCKER_HOST to the colima host and pipe to github env

### Why

the emulator tests were failing on macos because we need to account for colima's socket being different

prs.title: Signer update: Wait for parent block before submitting proposal
prs.truncated_body:
This updates the signer to check if their associated stacks-node has processed the parent block for a block proposal before submitting that block proposal. If it cannot confirm that the parent block has been processed, it waits a default time of 15s, configurable via `proposal_wait_for_parent_time_secs` in the signer config.toml.

The "wait" is realized by storing the proposal as a pending block

commits.message: feat: check if a proposals parent has been processed before submit
chore: update changelog, rename config option
make signer runloop run the "after-event" code on all invocations

Within the node's block validation endpoint, there is a new section for validation while in a transaction replay mode. A few different tes

prs.title: chore: Introduced CryptoUtils
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This PR introduces `CryptoUtils`, a class with commonly used cryptographic functionality that is independent of the underlying domain model (unlike some of the functionality in `CryptoStatic`). This is preparatory work for moving `Address` and `AddressBook` to the `consensus-model` in the next step. Also, renamed `DetRandomProvider` to avoid confusion.

prs.title: Fix acceptance operator leaking remaining hbars (0.128)
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

Cherry pick of #10987 to release/0.128

* Add signature logging to help diagnose `INVALID_SIGNATURE` error encountered in staging environment
* Convert `AccountClient.getTokenTreasuryAccount()` to use standard `AccountClient.getAccount(AccountNameEnum)`
* Fix ECDSA accounts not signing create with their private key (currently only ECDSA account is also receiverSigRequired=t

commits.message:
Fix acceptance operator leaking remaining hbars (#10987)

* Add signature logging to help diagnose `INVALID_SIGNATURE` error encountered in staging environment
* Convert `AccountClient.getTokenTreasuryAccount()` to use standard `AccountClient.getAccount(AccountNameEnum)`
* Fix ECDSA accounts not signing create with their private key (currently only ECDSA account is also receiverSigRequired=true)
* Fix leaking of hbars during unsuccessful account deletions by falling back to crypto transfer of remaining funds
* Increase schedule expiry from 16s to 25s to workaround timing issue failure in slower environments

Signed-off-by: Steven Sheehy <steven.sheehy@swirldslabs.com>

prs.title: Add the missing contract key in the state (0.128)
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
Cherry-pick from #10968.

commits.message:
Add the missing contract key in the state (#10968)

This PR is a workaround for the following scenario: a contract with a null key was deployed and imported in the mirror node DB (before the fix in hiero-ledger/hiero-consensus-node#15990). The parent transaction has a payer which is the one set as a sender in the transaction. The key verification is fine. A child transaction is created from the contract call. The latter transaction has a payer set to the contract and its key is verified against the contract's key which is null, hence the error in this issue.

This was resolved in services by adding a default key from ContractID(shard, realm, num). This PR in the mirror node mocks this logic until we have a real DB migration - when an account is read in the AccountReadableKVState its key is set before the account is put in the state as an object. If the key is null and the entity is of type 'contract' now a dummy key is added from ContractID(shard, realm, num) as if the migration was already run.

Note: the contracts following the fix in services do not have this issue.

---------

Signed-off-by: Bilyana Gospodinova <bilyana.gospodinova14@gmail.com>

prs.title: Add missing `id-token: write` permission in release pipeline
prs.truncated_body:
### Changelog

This PR addresses my comment [here](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/pull/5644#pullrequestreview-2783361729):
- Give the CI pipeline the permission to mint an OIDC token, and
- Put the provenance flag into the environmental variable.

commits.message:
Add missing `id-token: write` permission in release pipeline

Signed-off-by: Pascal Marco Caversaccio <pascal.caversaccio@hotmail.ch>

prs.title: Neo.CLI: fix NeoFS testnet configuration
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Since we're going to release 3.8 next week, I'm checking C# node wrt ability to process NeoFS chains. This PR fixes incompatibility in NeoFS testnet protocol configuration. See https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/blob/master/config/protocol.testnet.neofs.yml as a reference.

## Type of change

- [X] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# How Has This Been Test

commits.message:
Neo.CLI: update NeoFS testnet configuration

Ref.
https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/blob/master/config/protocol.testnet.neofs.yml.

Signed-off-by: Anna Shaleva <shaleva.ann@nspcc.ru>

prs.title: Optimize memory usage
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

The main problem is that we have two `HashSetCache` per remote node connected, every of them use 20_000 entries * 10 buckets, that's means 200_000 entries * 2 = 400_000 entries of 256 bytes, this can reach more 100mb of ram per node connected. **I reduce this value from 400_000 entries to 20_000 per node.**

Require https://github.com/neo-project/neo/pull/3904

## Type of chan

commits.message: Add doc an limit also TaskManager
